official-title.#text:
To amend the National Voter Registration Act of 1993 to
		  permit a State to require an applicant for voter registration in the State who
		  uses the Federal mail voter registration application form developed by the
		  Election Assistance Commission under such Act to provide documentary evidence
		  of citizenship as a condition of the State’s acceptance of the
		  form.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Permitting States to
			 require voter registration applicants using Federal mail form to submit
			 documentary evidence of citizenship as condition of acceptance of
			 application

quote.#text:
,
			 except that a State may require an applicant who submits such form to provide
			 documentary evidence of the applicant’s citizenship as a condition of the
			 State’s acceptance of the form.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended by striking the period at the end and inserting the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 6(a)(1) of
			 the National Voter Registration Act of 1993

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall apply with
			 respect to elections for Federal office held after the date of the enactment of
			 this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 2409 IH: State Sovereignty in Voting Act
